short_summary: Construct and install CCA wooden floating docks and accessories for Ile d Entrée fishing harbour to Iles-de-la-Madeleine.
description: The work comprises: - Provisions and labor for manufacturing floating docks and steel, galvanized and aluminum accessories; - Delivery and installation of floating docks and accessories to the fishing harbour; - Installation of floating docks, cables, arms and all onsite adjustments.

full_summary:
### Construction of CCA Wooden Floating Docks and Accessories for Ile d’Entrée Fishing Harbour

**Tender No.** 30005003
**Category:** CNST - Construction Services
**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
**Location:** Gaspésie–Îles-de-la-Madeleine
**Publication Date:** October 24, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** November 8, 2023, 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
**Tender Status:** Expired

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking a Construction Service Provider to design, manufacture, and install CCA wooden floating docks and accessories for the Ile d’Entrée fishing harbour in the Iles-de-la-Madeleine. The contract is a conditional set-aside under the Federal Government Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB).

**Scope of Work:**

The successful bidder will be required to supply and install the following:

* Materials and labours for the construction of the floating docks and steel galvanized and aluminum accessories
* Materials and specialized labours for the installation of the HDPE dry boxes
* Delivery of the floating docks and accessories to the designated location
* Installation of the docks, cables, and strong arms, as indicated on the drawings
* Site visits to ensure compliance with the specified project milestones

**Key Dates:**

* Tender closing date: November 8, 2023, 2:00 PM (Eastern Time)
* Project completion date: April 26, 2024
* Marine Liability Insurance will be required for the use of a boat during the project

**Reporting:**

The Contractor must submit detailed project plans to the Contracting Officer prior to the commencement of work. Bi-weekly progress reports shall be submitted while the project is ongoing.

**Eligibility:**

The tender is open to all qualified bidders, however, it is conditionally set-aside under the PSIB. Goods and services may only be acquired from Indigenous businesses employed within Canada, under the Purchase Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if the contract is awarded to a certified Indigenous business.

**Contact Information:**

Marie-France Chrétien
Fisheries and Oceans Canada
301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, NB, E3C 2M6
Phone: (450) 521-4448
Email: [marie-france.chretien@dfo-mpo
